snippet: The world’s largest publicly traded oil company reported net income of $9.4 billion for the quarter, up from $9.25 billion the year before.
abstract: Exxon Mobil reports slightly higher fourth-quarter earnings as higher revenue for oil partly compensated for lower natural gas prices and soft refinery returns on chemicals and lubricants; company reports net income of $9.4 billion for the quarter, up from $9.25 billion the year before.
lead_paragraph: The world’s largest publicly traded oil company reported net income of $9.4 billion for the quarter, up from $9.25 billion the year before.

headline.main: Higher Oil Prices Raise Earnings at Exxon Mobil
headline.print_headline: Higher Oil Prices Raise Earnings at Exxon Mobil
